name: r19 Data Visualization Kit
description:
Important update after Feb 24 2022!

After the war russia criminally started in my Native Land I'd like to introduce several changes for use of this package.

  1. If you would like to support my work and show your appreciation - please donate money for Ukrainian Army, believe me - this helps a lot. Here's one of the trusted resources to make a donation https://www.comebackalive.in.ua, https://savelife.in.ua
  2. This pack is still available for all my colleagues all over the world, except russians. Russian designer - you should follow your warship.


It's a tough task to present data in a most convenient to the end viewer form and make it visually appealing. This project is meant to help you in achieving this ambitious goal.


I included the most common visualizations in this library, so you can find a corresponding chart that suits your needs and use as a reference in your work.


The core of the library is the set of the most suitable for big data viz color scales - designed with taking into account perception of information and all color vision deficiencies.


Do not hesitate to contact me and say “Hi” or ask your question by email to antonmalashkevych@gmail.com or get in touch on LinkedIn.


If you'd like to take your appreciation to the next level - here's BuyMeaCoffee Link. Thanks for your support!


The kit includes following charts organised into categories:


Distributions:

  • Bar charts
  • Density curves
  • Box plots
  • Violin plots
  • Histograms


Change Over Time:

  • Line charts
  • Sparklines
  • Connected scatter plots
  • Box plots
  • Bar charts


Comparisons:

  • Bar charts
  • Grouped bar charts
  • Lollipop charts
  • Dot plots
  • Ridgelines
  • Heatmaps
  • Line charts
  • Box plots
  • Violin plots
  • Sparklines


x-y Relationships:

  • Scatter plots
  • Bubble charts
  • Paired scatter plots
  • Slopegraph
  • Density contours
  • Hex bins
  • Corellograms
  • Line charts


Proportions:

  • Pie charts
  • Donut charts
  • Grouped bar charts
  • Stacked bar charts
  • Waffle chart / Grid plot
  • Mosaic plot / Marimekko chart
  • Tree map
  • Stacked area chart
  • Part of the total area chart
  • Stream graph
  • Parallel sets / Sankey diagrams


Geospatial Data:

  • Choropleth map
  • Cartogram heatmap
  • Cartogram hexbin
  • Bubble map
  • Dorling cartogram


Uncertainty:

  • Error bars & variations
  • Confidence strips
  • Half-eyes
  • Quantile dot plot
  • Confidence band


It’s free to download and use (even commercially) - check out Project Description and License information inside the Figma file. 


I sincerely hope this project will serve not only to facilitate the work of other designers, but will also be educational for some extent. Check out Attribution and Reading list pages for my book recommendation.


I see this library and style guide as my contribution for the worldwide design community and all those wonderful people making world a more beautiful and comfortable place to live.
